column2: cajungirl053, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed Encora to me after I  explained to her I was experiencing mood swings and feeling tired all the time. I had had a partial hysterectomy 14 years prior, but not any hormones due to my levels were still up.  Took Encora with no side effects, felt better than I did in years. One day went to re-fill and my pharmacist informed me of the recall.  Since then, I have been taken another Women's Vitiamin Pack (6 tablets verse 2) daily) and am re-experiencing the emotional mood swings, feeling really tired.  Had my doctor check the ingredient of the vitiams and she gave me a list of additional vitiamins for me to take along with the 6 pills already taking.  Still not feeling much better.  Does any one know when a vitiamin like Encora will be on the market?

column2: PHC, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The omega-3 helped in lowering my cholestrol and I also found that the Encora had enhanced my memory and maintained my energy level to the max.  After it was recalled and my discontinued of the vitamin and I found that my energy level had dropped drastically and I have a hard time remembering thinks unless I write it down. The 3 years that I was on Encora I felt great and I'm a mom of 2 highly intelligent and energenic children (9yr son and 3 1/2 yr old daughter)  and an entreprenuer (16 yrs) and trying to balance everything is very exhausting.  However, when I was on the vitamin (Encora) exhaustion was not even in the picture.  Since May 2009 (after I had completed my last pack) I have tried other mutivitamins and other supplements, I noticed they did not help.  I'm always tired now and my  memory is very poor.  I need to be back on Encora (I don't know if the FDA had lifted the recall). I believed Encora had worked very well for me personally.

column9: Started medication about 3 weeks ago, due to premenopausal symptom, including moodiness and lots of tears. Since I started this medicine, I'm feeling alot less teary and feel more in control of things.  I have noteices slight weight gain but not much.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 42 years old. I had a hysterectomy in Jan. 08 but still have my ovaries. I had started having hot flashes and moodiness again around Sept. My doctor checked my hormones but I was not menaposal. She started me on the Encora and I have felt much better.  I have been on them for 3 months and hardly ever have the flashes or mood swings.  I never had a weight issue until about 3 years ago.  I slowly started gaining weight and dieting didn't help.  Since being on the vitamins I have dropped 12 pounds without dieting.  Its really has balanced my hormones.  I am very satisfied.

column2: Encora, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: I am allergic to 'cod fish' and to ''soy''.I have had very severe abdominal problems for months now, since I started taking Encora vitamins.  My physician gave them to me, and possibly was unaware of the fact that I am allergic to soy, cod fish.  I always am a Type A bloodtype 57 yr old female, and I do not absorb calcium carbonate well at all.  I do best on Citracal supplements.  Thus this vitamin has ran amuck in my system due to my food (soy and cod fish) allergies, and due to my blood type problems with calcium carbonate.Encora includes cod liver oil, soy, and calcium carbonate in their vitamin regimen.Now all the excess gas, severe abdominal cramping, and allergic reactions will have a chance to stop, so that I may live a normal life.

column2: Kate, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: These were prescribed by my GYN. I was leary about taking them since I have had trouble with nausea when taking vitamins. No trouble! I felt great when I took them. 2 in the morning, two at night. They helped me sleep, and gave me energy during the day. I highly recommend them.

column2: djamado@optonline.net, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had a bone narrowing and constant severe pain down my arm and fingers eight months.I could not sleep either. The pain was unbearable. After taking Encora for less than one month the pain went away completely! I forgot to take it for one week when I had a cortisone shot and the pain came back in full force. The shot did not work for the pain but encora did. After taking it regurlarly for the next week the pain dissappeared and has not come back! I was told I would need surgery to eliminate the pain. I consider encora a miracle and recommend it to anyone dealing with pain as a resulting from issues with bones. I also sleep better and the doctor told me at 48 I have the uterus of a 20 year old. Side effects include decrease in bowel movements. I have also noticed my skin lighened. Has anyone else?
